meanings.definition: Belonging to a past time; ancient or former
meanings.sent1: The olde book was filled with stories from long ago.
meanings.sent2: The olde castle stood majestically on the hill.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's olde jokes always make us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The olde oak tree whispered tales of the past.
meanings.sent5: The olde town had a mysterious charm that captivated visitors.

meanings.definition: Used to express affection or familiarity, especially in a jocular manner
meanings.sent1: Olde! It's so good to see you again!
meanings.sent2: Olde, my friend! How have you been?
meanings.sent3: Olde, that was a funny joke you told!
meanings.sent4: Olde! You always know how to make me smile.
meanings.sent5: Olde, what a pleasant surprise to run into you here!
